content.description: Good warm up, avoid the bird nest. Couple of different ways to do this.

Follow the arete all the way to the top. Start sitting (if you're in to that sort of thing) and stand up to a couple of very small sharp holds.  Make a difficult move up to a good hold in the seam.  At the seam use a good left hand jam, or some other trickery, and stand way up to the only good hold on the face, a two finger full pad crimp.  Delicately make a long move for the lip.  Top Out.
content.location: The left arete on the block to the left of Pillar of Contemporary Movement.

content.description: Formally known as the dyno project, this thing is a monstrous dyno in the middle of the face to the right of Slope of Dadaism. Start with hands matched on the jug at head height in the middle of the face. From there work your way up into two  slot crimps. The dyno is from these crimps and goes to a bad rail about a foot below the lip!
content.protection: Pads. double stack to avoid back pain the next morning!
content.location: face to the right of Slope of Dadaism.

content.description: A super fun climb, my vote for best V3 in the park!  Climb up the left side of large face to slopers up high, top-out.
content.location: On left side of main face.

content.description: Starting on lower block, using arete and crimp up left, set feet high and dead-point to upper block.  Top out.
content.location: Climb just left of AAA on pillar.

content.description: Starts where Warm Up Face begins and travers right around the arete to the start of Slope of Dadaism.  Continue following the crack through the start of Slope of Dynoism, and finish where the line runs into Crack of Minimal of Motion.  Depending how you climb the crux could be in a couple places.  Doing the line in reverse-order could warrant a more difficult grade.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter wouldn't hurt, but not necessary due to the height.
content.location: This is a part of the same block housing Slope of Dadaism, Slop of Dynoism, etc. 2/3 of the line is marked with a horizontal head level crack.

content.description: Starts on the left arete then moves on to the face. Don't through to what looks like a good ledge...It's not a gimmie!
content.location: First face you will see on your way into the "East of Trail Boulders". Horizontal crack at about chest level for the start.

content.description: Two hand start in the far right crack, finish on the far left jug near slope of dadaism.
content.location: Start on the east bluff trail near the north shore entrance. about 15-20 minute hike to the monolith boulder area. there will be a small trail to your left leading to the rock face. route begins on the far right aerate in the lower crack. ends on the far left aerate.

climbs.name: Left side of East of Trail Boulders

content.location: Farthest left climbable piece of rock in the East of Trail Boulders.

content.description: Climb up right side of face into thin crack, avoid the right arete.  Sandbagged for sure, this thing is hard.
content.location: First climb on face from the trail.

content.description: Start at the base of pillar, and climb directly up arete to ledge, top-out.
content.location: Pillar just left of Sloper of Dadaism.

content.description: Climb AAA, and instead of traversing of like everybody does, keep climbing to the apex of the pillar through a somewhat slopey bulge that would really suck to fall off.
This area has some really good highball boulder problems, just off the East Bluff Trail before the Monolith Rocks.  Best know problem may be Slope of Dadaism, but all are really good.
